key_points: COVID-19 vaccines are highly effective at preventing severe disease, but breakthrough cases still occur.
The CDC tracks hospitalizations and deaths among the fully vaccinated, but not all breakthrough infections.
Research involved reviewing data on breakthrough cases, hospitalizations, and deaths from official state sources for all 50 states and D.C.
Not all hospitalizations and deaths in fully vaccinated individuals are due to COVID-19.
Half of the states report data on COVID-19 breakthrough events, but the frequency and detail of reporting vary.
Breakthrough cases, hospitalizations, and deaths among the fully vaccinated are extremely rare according to data from states.
Rates of breakthrough cases among the fully vaccinated are below 1% in all reporting states.
More than 90% of COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths occur among unvaccinated or not fully vaccinated individuals.
State-level data indicates COVID-19 breakthrough events among the fully vaccinated are rare in the U.S.
The data support the effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccines and the importance of robust state-level data for monitoring vaccine effectiveness.
